overview.problemStatement: For a graph G" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">GGG let τ(G)" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">τ(G)τ(G)\tau(G) denote the minimal number of vertices that include at least one from each maximal clique of G" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">GGG (sometimes called the clique transversal number). Estimate τ(G)" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">τ(G)τ(G)\tau(G). In particular, is it true that if G" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">GGG has n" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">nnn vertices thenτ(G)≤n−ω(n)n" role="presentation" style="text-align: center; position: relative;">τ(G)≤n−ω(n)n‾√τ(G)≤n−ω(n)n
